definitions.definition: An inhabitant of Great Britain , particularly ( historical ) a Celt from the area of Roman Britain or ( obsolete ) a Welshman ; a British person.
examples: The ancient Britons were particularly fond of Anglesey , which the Romans knew as Mona .

definitions.definition: A citizen of the United Kingdom or ( historical , obsolete ) its overseas empire .
examples: The victims included 3 Canadians, 2 Irishmen, and 1 Briton .
The hiker was a Briton from New Zealand.

main_definition: An inhabitant of Great Britain , particularly ( historical ) a Celt from the area of Roman Britain or ( obsolete ) a Welshman ; a British person.
secondary_definitions: A citizen of the United Kingdom or ( historical , obsolete ) its overseas empire .
